sentences.sentence: Scotland's former First Minister Nicola Sturgeon has been arrested by police investigating the finances of the ruling Scottish National Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: EC President Ursula von der Leyen leads a European delegation to Tunisia, offering economic aid in return for migration controls.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Firefighters from around the world arrive in Canada to help tackle out-of-control blazes that officials warn could last all summer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Former Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon has been arrested by police investigating the finances of Scotland's governing Scottish National Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Her arrest follows that of her husband, former SNP chief executive Peter Murrell.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The investigation is thought to centre on the use of party money for inappropriate purposes and a lack of transparency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Sturgeon has repeatedly denied that her resignation in February had anything to do with the developing police inquiry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Thank you so much.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: EC President Ursula von der Leyen has led a European delegation to Tunisia, hoping to persuade President Kayyar Syed to impose tighter controls on migration to Europe in return for economic aid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Maloney and Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte migration to Europe in return for economic aid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Maloney and Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte were in the team sent to Tunisia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The EU says it's willing to offer 900 million euros in economic aid as part of a five-point programme that includes support halting illegal immigration. Tunisia is just 150 kilometers from the Italian island of Lampedusa and has become a favored departure point for those seeking to travel to Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But President Syed has said he is unwilling for Tunisia to act as the continent's border guard.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: act as the continent's border guard. A country in flames.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: New and intensifying wildfires are forcing thousands of people to be evacuated across Canada as the country battles out of control blazes that officials warn could last all summer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Nearly 18,000 square miles have burned since the beginning of the year, which authorities say serves as a stark reminder of the devastating effects of climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The US has sent hundreds of firefighters to Canada over the past few weeks and says more help is on its way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: That includes fleets from further afield, including South Africa, Australia and New Zealand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said on Thursday that France, Portugal and Spain were sending at least 280 firefighters to Canada.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: More than 111 million people in the US have been under air quality alert since Thursday due to the fires.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The wildfire smoke from Canada was also detected thousands of miles away in Norway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Former U.S. President Donald Trump made his first appearance since his federal indictment on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Speaking to Republican audiences in Georgia and North Carolina, Trump looked to rally supporters to his defense by dismissing the charges brought by the U.S. Justice Department.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The ridiculous and baseless indictment of me by the Biden administration's weaponized Department of Injustice will go down as among the most horrific abuses of power in the history of our country. Many people have said that, Democrats have even said it. This vicious persecution Many people have said that, Democrats have even said it. This vicious persecution is a travesty of justice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It comes as federal prosecutors unsealed a wide-ranging indictment of Donald Trump on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They accused the former president of endangering national security by keeping top-secret nuclear and defense documents after leaving the White House.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Trump denies any wrongdoing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: People across Europe and beyond took part in annual pride parades over the weekend in a celebration of LGBTQ rights, achievements and communities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Rome, campaigners took to the streets and called out what they see as attacks on the community under Prime Minister Giorgio Maloney's government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Tallinn, paraders took to the streets once again after a six-year break, under the motto One for All and All for Equality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Earlier this month, Prime Minister Kadia Kallis tabled a bill to legislate marriage for gay couples.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And across the sea in Washington, US President Joe Biden hosted the largest Pride event to be held at the White House.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He used the occasion to condemn the recent wave of quote, �callous and cynical state laws restricting LGBTQ rights.�
